full_text: This knitting pattern is published for personal use. Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, and sale are prohibited. You may freely use the works, including personal use and sale. However, when introducing your work, please refrain from doing anything that undermines your identity as the author @lpre_ys, such as using an ``original pattern that you came up with''. This pattern is a text pattern (no illustrations). Knitting flow: Body → 1st cotton filling → ears → tail → 2nd cotton filling → face/parts. Create your favorite “Blobcat” by combining 2 types of bodies (plump tail/round body) and 3 types of ears (normal, horizontal ears, and standing ears). Thread used: Pierrot Fine Merino Gota 10 Mustard / Needle: No. 3 (circular needle or 5 needle), safety pin marker, black thread for embroidery, etc. Techniques: Magic loop or 5-needle, German short row (turnback knitting), etc. Finished size: approx. 8 cm diameter (with tail) This knitting pattern is published for personal use. Unauthorized redistribution, sharing or sale of the pattern itself is strictly prohibited. You are free to make and sell items made from this pattern. However, please do not present the pattern as “originally designed by you” — the designer is @lpre_ys. Credit to the designer is optional but appreciated! This is a text-only pattern (no charts). Assembly order: body → first stuffing → ears → tail → second stuffing → face & other parts. Variations: two body types (plump tail / round body), three ear types (normal / side ears / upright ears). Use whichever combination you like to knit your own Blobcat. Yarn: PIERROT Fine Merino Medium-Weight #10 Mustard. Needles: Japanese size 3 (≈ US 2.5 mm). Also: stuffing, black embroidery thread, safety-pin markers. Techniques: Magic loop or 5 double-pointed needles, German short rows (short-row shaping). Finished size: approx. 8 cm (including tail).
